igdb.name: Penarium
igdb.summary: Poor Willy. Trapped in a sinister circus, his only hope of seeing his family is to run and jump his way past an array of deathtraps while being cheered on by a sadistically bloodthirsty crowd.

reviews.review:
Penarium is a pure platformer. No exploration, no shooting. Only moving and jumping. 

What else is there? A self-contained level whose borders you can cross to find yourself on the other side, and traps. Tons of traps that cycle during the duration of the level. Machine-guns, homing missiles, bubble-gum to make the platforms sticky while a see-saw journeys across… The goal of the game is to collect items that spawn in the level while avoiding different sets of traps. Simple, and yet effective.

This game is exactly what I was looking for. I am quite sick of the ‘muscle memory’ platformers where you have to learn by heart at which point of the level you jump, the perfect trajectory to land between spikes, and so on. Penarium focuses on the moment-to-moment frantic experience. Quick skills are required instead of a good finger memory, and it is rather telling that less than 20% of the players completed the 1st world. Penarium is very difficult, and as it sports a “sadistic circus” theme, you would have to be a masochist to like it. 

And yet I never found its difficulty to cross the “unfair” invisible line. The hitbox of the character is actually smaller than he looks. The movements are perfect, with double-jump and responsive controls without either the sliding momentum or the input delay that harm many platformers. The traps are more or less hard to avoid, but all can be predictable or give the player visual cues. But yeah, quick thinking and fast reflexes are mandatory. Oh, and I really appreciate that there is no timer adding an external pressure to the action. It is possible to either rush through the traps, or time them carefully. 

So despite the high difficulty, moving like a madman and surviving amongst the chaos is exhilarating. It is fun. It does not feel like the game is punishing the player, because the action is constant and the threats come from everywhere while still being manageable. And the variety/movement of traps help make the game not feel repetitive. It can be finished in a few hours, and this type of game is not enjoyable if it gets much longer than that. To extend the fun, there is an endless mode with permanent progression.

To conclude, I was surprised to love this simple game so much more than the other hardcore platformers. I think it’s due to the good maneuverability, the difficult yet manageable design, and most of all the dynamic traps that require quick skills and provide a lot of fun by getting rid of the ‘muscle memory’ level design that usually goes with that kind of platformers.  

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=712733656

Oh the joy and the lower back pains this game gave me..
Penarium is an addictive game. It is so simple and I had so much fun, a game you would expect from Team 17.
I hope Willy gets to do some other things except from jumping and running in the sequel (if there is one?).

10/10 would recommend!  \(^_^)/

This game is very addictive, fun, challenging and pretty. I'm normally not a fan of big pixels style but here it works somehow. Combine that with a simple, yet suprisingly effective story, and you've got something really worth its small price.   Also there' an endless arcade mode and co-op, thought for some reason my other controller refused to work. 
My score: solid 7.5/10
This is highly addictive. I don't remember being that much hooked up on something since Darkwing Duck on NES.

Really great little game, highly polished artstyle and tight controls, so tight, that I become sexually aroused when playing it.

Devilishly difficult with Meat Boy levels of frustration.

One disappointment is you can't play the campaign missions in co-op, but the other co-op modes (survival and versus) are satisfying. Though I initially bought this just for the co-op and was slightly miffed to find this isn't the next Towerfall, it then turned out the game has a meaty single player and excellent arcade mode so no worries a ding ding dong.

Penarium is a pleasant surprise. Bursting with personality, this arena-based arcade game is simple to look at, but a ton of fun to play. 

Seriously, you need to check this one out!

https://youtu.be/wX_AL6sV_kg
Fun game, nice art, great music and lots of fun playing the story line.

Great game. Frustrating, addicting and hard.
Definitly worth the money.
Penarium is ridiculous and chaotic, I love it!

This game is very challenging, and a LOT of fun. I got the 50 deaths achievement within 40 minutes of play, but never once felt frustrated or that the game was unfair. The gameplay is deceptively simple: all you do is jump between platforms. However, the different level goals, and the absurd amount of continuously changing trap combinations, force you to keep an eye on the entire screen and always keep you on your toes.

The campaign appears to be somewhat short, i seem to be over halfway through it within an hour of play, though your mileage may vary. Personally i feel that i got my money's worth, but you may want to keep that in mind. There is also an endless survival mode and a local multiplayer mode which further extend the game.

I love everything about the game so far, from the gameplay, to the art, to the music, to the setting, and definitely recommend it.

Penarium is an old school single screen wrap around skill based platformer in the spirit of games like bubble bobble. It's got a great graphic style and a good difficulty curve I often found myself finishing a level after thinking just one more try, which is exactly like it should be for skill based game like this. The music is fits nicely with the theme and the short span and the variety make it's tricky levels fun, replayable and well balanced. While certainly tough at times, the game always feels fair, the game has good weighty feel to it's physics and collision detection are great, when you die, which you will many many times, it's because you made a mistake. A charming little game more than worth it's price 4/5.
Fun game to pass time or to just have a 5 minute break.
love the game very simple but fun lol

I had been playing this game for around half an hour every day for several months, trying to complete the campaign mode. I got all the way up to the last level and I couldn't beat it. Took a break for a few months and went back to try again. It took me a week but I finally completed campaign mode.

This game is insanely difficult, and so many times I died from either missing a jump or barely touching one of the many obstacles. I hate the birds, the dragons, the rockets and those icicles, and I have no idea how you can break more than 50 of those barrels.

So overall I enjoyed Penarium and felt so satisfied beating it.

What can I say about Penarium?

I was going to criticise it for being short. It is short, but it's exactly as long as it needs to be. There's something to be said for a game that can be completed in a single sitting, and never feel repetitive or like it's dragging its feet.

I was going to criticise it for being simple. It is simple, but its simplicity is elegant. The combinations of its approximately 15 traps make for some beautifully intense and varied gameplay.

I was going to criticise it for playing like a bonus challenge minigame at the end of a more fleshed-out game. It is reminiscent of a bonus challenge minigame, but unlike such games, it's well-designed, balanced, clever, and difficult to master.

So now, given the satisfying, challenging gameplay, beautifully realised pixel-art, and surprisingly engrossing setting and characters, I'm left with only one complaint:

Why is it that a rolling rock that could (and often will) crush me in an instant, does not crush the barrels I'm supposed to break!?
Addicting & fun! Love to play in local coop mode!
Engraçado e difícil =D

appDetails.name: Penarium
appDetails.detailed_description:
Penarium is set in a sinister circus arena, where contestants, much like Gladiators of old, are forced to entertain a sadistic crowd. In this frantic 2D arena arcade game, you take on the role of our quirky antihero; Willy who, to survive, is forced to run, jump and avoid an array of killer death-traps. Succeed and Willy will become the Champion of Penarium. Fail and he will die in a most horrendous way, much to the delight of the baying crowd.

Guide poor Willy through this evil madness in single player and 2 player local COOP and Competitive modes. Every kid wants to go to circus but no kid wants to die in one.

Feature List


  • 3 Arenas
  • 4 Game Modes
  • Campaign mode featuring 30 challenges
  • Arcade mode featuring over a dozen of unlockable power-ups
  • COOP and VS local multiplayer
  • Online leaderboards
  • Dark comical dialogue and cutscenes

igdb.name: Broken Age
igdb.summary:
Broken Age is a point-and-click adventure telling the stories of a young boy and girl leading parallel lives. The girl has been chosen by her village to be sacrificed to a terrible monster--but she decides to fight back. Meanwhile, a boy on a spaceship is living a solitary life under the care of a motherly computer, but he wants to break free to lead adventures and do good in the world. Adventures ensue.

Broken Age development began when we asked our community if they would help us create a classic-style adventure game without needing to rely on traditional publishers. It turns out they did.

And ever since day one, 2 Player Productions has been recording the whole process in an ongoing series of in-depth episodes documenting the creation of a game. Stay tuned for details on how to get your hands on it.

esrb.synopsis: This is a point-and-click adventure game in which players assume the role of two teenagers trying to stop creatures from destroying their world. Players explore fantastical environments, interact with different characters, and search for items to progress the story. A handful of sequences depict various acts of violence: a character firing lasers at a giant monster; characters engaging in hand-to-hand combat; a ship hit with exploding projectiles. One sequence depicts a large chum bucket filled with red blood-like liquid. During the course of the game, a character coerces a tree creature into vomiting tree sap into a bucket. The word “damn” is heard in the dialogue.

pegi.synopsis:
The content of this game is suitable for persons aged 12 years and over only.
It contains: Non realistic looking violence towards human characters

reviews.review: While a beautiful and engaging game at the start, Act II didn't deliver on any of the promises built up in the first section of the game.  Characterization is swept aside, the puzzles are tedious, and no satisfying resolution is presented to the story presented.  It feels like there should've been an Act III to really complete the game.  I don't regret playing it, necessarily, but neither would I necessarily recommend it to someone else.

only in Gaming Can you have CEO like Tim Schaffuer relentlessly denegrate and lie about the audience that not only purchases the product, but funds the entire thing (kickstarter). i could give this game a bad review and it would be justified because Tim openly lies about gamers, but truth is, i have integrity, so here we go:


GAMEPLAY: as a point and click Adventure - this GAME is solid, no game breaking glitches, or unwinnable scenarios. This game has no deaths, and limited inventory items (which means fewer useless objects being hauled around). Where the game-play diverts from a traditional point and click, is there are no ' True timing based ' problems, meaning everything is sequential, so if a character watching something ' just gets back' that means you've missed a step or you're not doing the correct solution. Talking to characters, is also essential in solving problems, and the way the game is there are certain characters you need to talk with, talk to other characters, and THEN return to the character to open new dialouge. Most puzzles cannot be 'brute forced' or even 'logically/systematically' solved, so you may be wasting time taking excessive notes during gameplay. although to be fair during the 2nd act there are more logic/mind puzzles which are satisfying to finally solve. There are also a particular puzzle that is really Rigid, its a "timing" based sequence, but its very unforgiving, and its not clear what you are exactly trying to do, also there are elements that arent obvious to make it even more convelouted. you just have to repetatively perform the same task over and over until you see what exactly you're missing, then once you 'see it' you will have to suffer more frustration as you realize the timing aspect doesn't set you up to complete the sequence, with out some back and forth...

the length of the game feels about right for a $8 game. but $20 is outrageous, Thimbleweed park is a much better buy at that pricepoint.


GRAPHICS/DESIGN: there is no real nostalgia factor here for the point-and-click genre, instead you have a 'storybook' motiff through out, that has animation like it came out of flash, now its much more sophisticated and polished, and it looks great. The characters are Cute, HOWEVER they did go cheap in that there are 2 missing Characters in the Game! they are referenced multiple times, you're even told they are in a room with other characters, but you never see them, even at the END of the game where everyone is reunited these two characters are not present, it totally breaks continuity and just is such a huge oversight.



 SOUND: The music is SIMPLY AMAZING, and the VOICE ACTING IS SPOT on!, The best character (NPC) in the game BY FAR is Curtis the Wood-Cutter, he deserves his own point-and-click adventure title. i am Dead serious, he is so charismatic and likable, and absolutely hilarious, its a shame that he doesn't have a bigger role in the game, but then sometimes less is more.



STORY: a lot of people bag on the story... i actually thought that the story was REALLY creative! its unlike any other point-and-click title out there, its Fun, engaging, but slow to start. I do have to say the ENDING was REALLY Poorly handled, it felt like a rush job / hurry up and wrap it up, type thing, very anticlimatic, there should have been a 3rd act as everyone else said. Also the Glaring issue of 2 characters who are referenced through-out the game never showing up (from the Cloud city) - oh well i guess they just DIED, they don't even have names, just birdgirl one and two.


OVERALL: i would definitely put this game in the top 5 'New Point and click adventure games' one or two spots below thimbleweed park. i had fun playing it, and it was VERY SOLID despite its shortcomings.

Disclaimer: I played through the end of Act 1. I have not completed (or started) Act 2.

I have a love/hate relationship with adventure games. I like the creativity and story-telling involved, but hate that most devolve into random "guess what bizarre thing the designer was thinking" puzzles.

Broken Age (at least Act 1) was like that for me. The larger crime, however, is that I didn't find the story interesting or engaging. The end of Act 1 teases, I suppose, some coherence but really, for the most part you play as two different characters in two different worlds solving two entirely different sets of puzzles. I get that Act 2 may somehow tie these together, but after nearly 5 hours of Act 1, I just don't care.

If you love adventure games and don't mind a potentially dull story, give it a shot. Otherwise, move on as I have done.

Not recommended: 2.5 out of 5.
If you're really into click and point adventures that move at an extremely slow pace, this game is for you. If you're like me, it isn't.

appDetails.name: Broken Age
appDetails.detailed_description:
Broken Age is a family friendly, hand-animated, puzzle-filled adventure game with an all-star cast, including Elijah Wood, Jack Black and Masasa Moyo. Funded by a record breaking crowdfunding campaign and designed by industry legend Tim Schafer, Broken Age is a timeless coming-of-age story of barfing trees and talking spoons.

Vella Tartine and Shay Volta are two teenagers in strangely similar situations, but radically different worlds. The player can freely switch between their stories, helping them take control of their own lives, and dealing with the unexpected adventures that follow.

Starring:

Elijah Wood as Shay
Masasa Moyo as Vella
Jack Black as Harm'ny Lightbeard
Jennifer Hale as Mom
Wil Wheaton as Curtis
Pendleton Ward as Gus

igdb.name: JumpJet Rex
igdb.summary:
JumpJet Rex is a punishing, old school 2-D platformer where players take control of a Tyrannosaurus Rex with extraterrestrial jump boots to save dino-kind from extinction by a giant asteroid.

As Rex, players will jump, drop and dash through more than 40 challenging levels and race against the clock to not only preserve life during the Mesozoic era, but also prove their platforming prowess against other dino enthusiasts.

Players can explore the galaxy and unlock new worlds alone or team up with a friend in co-op mode, where players will need to coordinate movements to get past challenges.

reviews.review: u can play with freind!!

appDetails.name: JumpJet Rex
appDetails.detailed_description:
Retro Platformer Flare
JumpJet Rex features beautiful hand-drawn 16-bit graphics and classic chiptune music that transfers dino lovers back to the 2-D glory days of the early 90’s.

Secrets and Collectibles
With dozens of items stashed across the Galaxy, and many secret areas to discover, JumpJet Rex offers plenty to do for the treasure hunters in the house!

Replayability
With a time challenge twist, players can replay every level multiple times to prove their platforming prowess. Download ghosts to race against the best players in the world, or compete directly with your friends to see who can post the best times!

Killer Old School Gameplay
Remember when platformers were so tough that people would hurt their hands playing, but feel amazing after getting past a level? Relive those moments with JumpJet Rex’s strenuous platforming challenges and retro boss battles.

Co-op Mode
Saving all of dinokind from a giant asteroid barreling down on Earth is a pretty tall task for a T-Rex with tiny arms, so players can team up with a friend to take on challenges. Teammates must coordinate efforts in order to avoid mass obliteration.

Customization and Upgrades
No two T-Rex’s are alike and fans will be able to customize their character and upgrade their appearance with the loot they collect on their travels.

Jump, drop and dash your way through over 40+ levels via story, multiplayer arena & party, co-op and speedrun modes.  Be the dinonaut you always knew you were.

igdb.name: Tailwind: Prologue
igdb.summary: You are the last survivor of an alien invasion that has all but destroyed your homeworld. Barely escaping the atmosphere in your ship, the Keravnós, you realize you don’t have enough fuel to survive. You are going to die. Well, if this is your time, you might as well spend it doing what you do best: aerial ballet! Rain from the heavens as a bolt of lightning in one final blaze of glory.

igdb.name: Outlast
igdb.summary:
In the remote mountains of Colorado, horrors wait inside Mount Massive Asylum. A long-abandoned home for the mentally ill, recently re-opened by the “research and charity” branch of the transnational Murkoff Corporation, has been operating in strict secrecy… until now. 
 
Acting on a tip from an inside source, independent journalist Miles Upshur breaks into the facility, and what he discovers walks a terrifying line between science and religion, nature and something else entirely. Once inside, his only hope of escape lies with the terrible truth at the heart of Mount Massive.
igdb.storyline:
In the remote mountains of Colorado, horrors wait inside Mount Massive Asylum. A long-abandoned home for the mentally ill, recently re-opened by the “research and charity” branch of the transnational Murkoff Corporation, the asylum has been operating in strict secrecy… until now. 
 
Acting on a tip from an anonymous source, independent journalist Miles Upshur breaks into the facility, and what he discovers walks a terrifying line between science and religion, nature and something else entirely. Once inside, his only hope of escape lies with the terrible truth at the heart of Mount Massive. 
 
Outlast is a true survival horror experience which aims to show that the most terrifying monsters of all come from the human mind.

reviews.review:
Outstanding game, even better DLC 
Perfect atmosphere with amazing story and gameplay.
10/10 recommend

[b]Outlast[/b]

[h1]Positives[/h1]
• Beautiful visual quality and high level of detail
• Level design is creative and will put you in narrow corridors or air vents and compliments the horror with a bit of claustrophobia
• Very good example of how a linear game can be intense and thrilling and be focus on story
• Horror theme and atmosphere is the biggest strength
• Music and sound effects add to the experience immensely from the spine tingling ambience to the cries of the patient
• The setting of the insane asylum is crafted beautifully and is still believable even with the radical lore
• Enemies always seem to be elusive and demands you be able to think quickly and have your eyes peeled
• Phenomenal attention to detail in terms of the graphics and prop placement
• Gruesome scenes are very powerful and may even make you sick to your stomach 
• Moments where everything is dead silent build a great amount of anticipation between levels
• Music is correlated with chase sequences in building tension and helping you figure out where the enemy is
• Horror is quite unique and is balanced between repulsive scenes, jump scares and chases sequences
 • You are very weak compared to the enemies which makes hiding and running away even more important
• Levels require you to be reserved and patient to succeed
• Gameplay and pacing is consistent 
• Lore is deep and rich and although it's science fiction its still believable and doesn't hinder your immersion
• The Whistleblower DLC is perfect and not only provides tons of content, but it retells the plot from a new perspective which interlocks with the original
• Whistleblower levels are also better than the main game and its clear the developers put a lot of time into the narrative
• Whistleblower has a high attention to detail in the plot's timeline for example if something occurs in the base game, there is a point in the DLC that you may come across that or the effects of that event
• Achievements are manageable and it was fun to go back and play the game a second time which allowed me to pick up on how good the lore was
• Documents are sprinkled around the levels for those who go off the beaten path and add to the story.
• Dark areas require the use of night vision on your camcorder which make the already creepy world all the more horrifying
• You are able to feel your character since you can see the rest of your body, your arms moving and pressing your hand against the wall when looking around the corner, its the small details that count
• Your character's breathing screams or cries outlines the mood and disgust in each part
• Some enemies will not attack but taunt you or approach you and forms a grey area of uncertainty not knowing what a threat is

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
• Framerate is locked at 60 despite vertical sync being off
• Most of the game’s tasks and objectives revolve around turning gauges and flipping switches while being chased by an enemy
• At points I do question the plot where the protagonist does seem to make some irrational decisions but it's not too noticeable
• Music cues are have the same sound everytime and unfortunately never differ from each encounter
• Sometimes closing a door behind you results in closing it in front of you
• Jumping or vaulting is quite cumbersome and will not work at times

[b]Final Thoughts:[/b] Outlast truly  represents what most studios are afraid of, and that is to offend the player. I have yet to play a game that disgusted me and disturbed me more than Outlast. Its eerie vibe is felt the moment you see the asylum, isolated from civilization and morality. The plot slowly descends into a hell of necrophilia, cannibalism and murder. Especially the Whistleblower DLC really proved how fearless the developers are in making this experience . I’ll admit I wasn’t blown away by the graphics at first until actually started looking since running away from the asylums residence adverts your attention away from your surroundings. It wasn’t until I looked down at my feet and saw that I left a trail of bloody footprints after stepping on a body that I realized this. The footprints even faded as the blood was left on the ground. There is an amazing level of detail throughout the levels. Outlast finds the perfect balance of props and design elements so it feels realistic and everything has a reason for it being there. I do commend the game for its level design in that it does not feel like you are constricted to a single path by returning to some areas despite it being completely linear. In my opinion a game is not bad because it is linear, it is bad in the way you can tell the developers made a set sequence of events. After my third playthrough, I do wish I was able to fully explore the entire asylum and make my own adventure because the levels are so damn good. The first time there was a feeling of control I had over each level and had no idea what could've happened next. Many people criticize the parts where you have to flip three levers while playing cat and mouse with an enemy, where I find them as a strength where tension hangs in the air and makes you feel the most vulnerable in a way no jump scare can. I would also like to highlight the games difficulty where I wish the normal difficulty was harder, I do like the choice that there isn't an easy mode which would ruin any level of horror or challenge since if something can't hurt you, its not scary. The insane mode did give me a reason to go back since I did play it for the achievement and enjoyed learning the lore more in depth my next two playthoughs. Without going into detail, the horror aspects are very good, and have succeeded in being creative and heart-pounding. I also would like to point out how good the DLC is, it is even better than the base game and fills in some loose ends while telling the same story at the same time as the base game just from a different perspective. Outlast is an outstanding game in more ways than just the horror.

[b]Rating: 8.6/10[/b]

Outlast is a mad indie first-person survival psychological horror game 
in which you are playing a journalist that searches for evidence to destroy the Murkoff corporation.
You are getting an anonymous message that something is going wrong at Mount Massive Asylum, 
a closed psychiatry, which got reopend by the named company a few years ago.

говно ебаное я нахуй обосрался блять ПОРОСССЕНОЧЕК!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Outlast was a hell of a game. It will make you shiver, cry out loud, and shall give you dreams...only for nightmares. Outlast is not like any other horror game: it has a good story. It doesn’t repeat the same scenes- it is always different. The characters, oh the terrifying characters, will be the only things you imagine. The graphics for this thrilling game are amazing and makes this game realistic. The game lay is on-point, it isn’t too hard to spot things and if your there (Lillie an idiot) standing, forgetting the controls it will sometimes remind you so you don’t spend 10 minutes seeking for a shitty YouTube tutorial with shitty commentary. I highly recommend this game! But I warn you...if you are scared of people being chased... this game will make your life a living horror.

Outlast is the perfect example of an experiance that is limited by its medium, 90% of this game is you Irritatidly wandering around the darkness looking for some way to progress the story past the same interesting and well thought out monsters and charectors, which the first time around rattle the very fabric of your sanity, but the fourteenth time will leave you completely desensitized (and if your like me bored).  
Its not by any stretch of the imagination a bad game, far to the contrary, it is the single most terrifying experiance I've ever had, but it leaves far to much control up to the player, and with the Labyrinthian networks of possible paths, all in the complete darkness, it gets tedious. 
Another way the fact that this is a video game breaks the terror you might feel if you were otherwise experiancing it in say a movie setting, is in your abillity to ram headfirst and become killed by an enemy before you ever even recognize how afraid you should be. 
I could go on but I've already written an essay, which I won't edit down out of respect for this project. 
Please before buying this game, decide how long your actually willing to spend not afraid, not engaged, and lost to reach points of intrest.
This game is a piece of shit. Its bupid!!!! Anyone who likes this game unironically is bupid too.

appDetails.name: Outlast
appDetails.detailed_description:
Hell is an experiment you can't survive in Outlast, a first-person survival horror game developed by veterans of some of the biggest game franchises in history. As investigative journalist Miles Upshur, explore Mount Massive Asylum and try to survive long enough to discover its terrible secret... if you dare.

Synopsis:

In the remote mountains of Colorado, horrors wait inside Mount Massive Asylum. A long-abandoned home for the mentally ill, recently re-opened by the “research and charity” branch of the transnational Murkoff Corporation, the asylum has been operating in strict secrecy… until now.

Acting on a tip from an anonymous source, independent journalist Miles Upshur breaks into the facility, and what he discovers walks a terrifying line between science and religion, nature and something else entirely. Once inside, his only hope of escape lies with the terrible truth at the heart of Mount Massive.

Outlast is a true survival horror experience which aims to show that the most terrifying monsters of all come from the human mind.

Features:

  • True Survival Horror Experience: You are no fighter - if you want to survive the horrors of the asylum, your only chance is to run... or hide
  • Immersive Graphics: AAA-quality graphics give players a detailed, terrifying world to explore
  • Hide and Sneak: Stealth-based gameplay, with parkour-inspired platforming elements
  • Unpredictable Enemies: Players cannot know when - and from where - one of the asylum’s terrifying inhabitants will finally catch up to them
  • Real Horror: Outlast’s setting and characters are inspired by real asylums and cases of criminal insanity

Warning:

Outlast contains intense violence, gore, graphic sexual content, and strong language. Please enjoy.

igdb.name: Kentucky Route Zero
igdb.summary:
Kentucky Route Zero is a magical realist adventure game about a secret highway in the caves beneath Kentucky, and the mysterious folks who travel it. Gameplay is inspired by point-and-click adventure games (like the classic Monkey Island or King's Quest series, or more recently Telltale's Walking Dead series), but focused on characterization, atmosphere and storytelling rather than clever puzzles or challenges of skill. 
 
The game is developed by Cardboard Computer (Jake Elliott and Tamas Kemenczy). The game's soundtrack features an original electronic score by Ben Babbitt along with a suite of old hymns & bluegrass standards recorded by The Bedquilt Ramblers.

reviews.review: Like if David Foster Wallace and Flannery O'Connor collaborated on an adventure game ie amazing. This is probably one of the best gaming narratives of the last decade, looks beautiful, and pulls of the rare feat of making your meaningless choices feel profoundly significant. Part Three especially had me almost gasping at every sequence. The story starts as you playing as Conway, a delivery driver trying to make his last delivery, and for most of chapter one this seems like "just" a game of backwood weirdness, As the story expands,and you meet and eventually play as more characters, the scope of the story expands untill it becomes an interactive funeral procession for America itself, as well as (in the best postmodern tradition) an endlessly self reflective rumination on how we interact with games. Highly recommended-cant wait to see how the creators blow me away with the finish.

Sound design is gorgeous, the art is incredible, the dialogue is interesting and the characters are layered and captivating, the world feels rich and lived-in, and there's so much going on behind the scenes that I can't wait to learn more about it. Steeped in magical realism in late-stage capitalism, southern gothic overtones, and deeply influenced by theatre, this is a game that rewards the slow playthrough, to take your time and really let things sink in. This is not a game made for you to race to the finish (the devs certainly aren't), so stick around a while and enjoy yourself.
I like it, feels like a real world.
Please play this game. please. it's so good

appDetails.name: Kentucky Route Zero
appDetails.detailed_description:
Kentucky Route Zero is a magical realist adventure game about a secret highway in the caves beneath Kentucky, and the mysterious folks who travel it.

The game is developed by Cardboard Computer (Jake Elliott, Tamas Kemenczy, and Ben Babbitt), and features an original electronic score by Ben Babbitt along with a suite of old hymns & bluegrass standards recorded by The Bedquilt Ramblers.

The game is split into five acts. Acts I, II, III, and IV are available now. The remaining act will be released when it's completed. Taken as a whole, Kentucky Route Zero is roughly the length of a summer night.

Key Features

  • A focus on characterization, atmosphere and storytelling rather than clever puzzles or challenges of skill.
  • A unique art treatment inspired by theatrical set design.
  • A haunting score accompanies the ambient sounds of the bluegrass state.
  • Wander the highways of Kentucky.
  • Make some friends before morning.

appDetails.reviews:
"Smart, thoughtful, sweet and incredibly well crafted – it’s the perfect game to play in the small hours of a lonely night. Be warned though; it’ll leave you hungry for unknown roads and longing for an invitation to the blues."
Rock, Paper, Shotgun

"Evokes the feeling of old ghost stories told around a campfire. There's the familiarity of friends and family around a warm, man-made fire, but with it comes the unnerving tale of the strange and unusual. Kentucky Route Zero is beautifully bizarre and perfectly poignant, and most of all, deserves your attention."

9.5 - Destructoid

"However you respond to its ethereal imagery, this is a game which makes a rare suggestion: who a player is may be more important than what they do."

84/100 - PC Gamer

reviews.review:
This is a great and faithful reproduction of a classic boardgame.

Pros:
- yes, you can be a Troll!
- yes, featured original artwork

Cons:
- you need your old nerdy friends from childhood to play it properly, :)

7/10: faithful, but feels like a fan-project in places rather than a finished title.

"Okay, we need something for mouse wheel to do ingame"
"How about cofirming an action player is now at with the item he has mouse cursor over?"
"You mean, like in a shop window to buy item, or at alchemist to destroy item, right?"
"Yeah! On a side note, what should we do if player has too many options presented?"
"Lets add arrows to the sides of those screens, so player could navigate through them!"
"Great idea! We care about our players, and want to make this game as easy to use as possible!"
-The floppin devs

appDetails.name: Talisman: Prologue
appDetails.detailed_description:
Talisman Prologue is an adaptation of the classic fantasy board game Talisman by Games Workshop. This version focuses on single player experience.

An epic tale of dice rolling and card drawing takes you on a quest throughout the land to rescue Princesses, slay Dragons and recover lost artefacts. Play through over 50 quests using the Talisman board game rules, and learn the special abilities of all of the characters.

It's important to note that this is NOT a multiplayer game based on Talisman, this is a reworking of the rule-set to allow solo players to experience Talisman in a different way.

Features -
  • 10 Characters
  • 50 Quests
  • Endless Re-playability
  • Includes 6 bonus characters - Leprechaun, Amazon, Minotaur, Vampire Hunter and Sage

The multi-player game, Talisman Digital Edition, is available separately on Steam and can be found HERE.

igdb.name: Steredenn

Steredenn is a frenetic and chaotic space shooter, carved in big beautiful pixels, with insane boss battles. Embark in your ship and engage the fight against dreadful space pirates in a never-ending combat for your survival.

Steredenn is at the crossroads between a shmup and a rogue-like. Enjoy the infinite replayability of the game with its unforgiving gameplay, intense boss fights, (almost) randomly generated environments, twisted space events and a surprisingly large arsenal of weapons. Enhance your ship during your flight with many upgrades and forge your own path across the universe!

  • Beautiful art and spaceships.
  • Awesome boss fights.
  • Addictive, ruthless.
  • Endless arcade gameplay.
  • Quick and intense sessions.
  • INFINITE REPLAYABILITY: levels are (practically) randomly-generated.
  • ARSENAL: 35 weapons and 25 upgrades with many interactions and combos.
  • SCORING: beat your friends and be the best!
  • DAILY RUN: everyday, try to be the first in a special leaderboard where all players share the same run, guns and bosses. Beware, you only get one chance per day!
  • ARENA: Unlock a boss by defeating it in the normal mode. Then, train against it in a 1 to 1 duel. Your guns, your laws, your fight.

igdb.summary: Inspired by tarot and fantasy, all bets are off as you create your own journey by building a collection of cards used to deal out a boardgame-like dungeon teeming with enemies, treasure, and adventure. Upon entering combat, the cards come to life as the player is propelled into a beautiful 3D environment to brawl it out with foes. Draw your cards, play your hand, and discover your fate.

pegi.synopsis:
The content of this game is suitable for persons aged 16 years and over only.
It contains: Realistic looking violence

reviews.review:
Was really enjoying this game at first. Like, really, really enjoying this game. I didn't mind the combat and I liked all the rest of it.

Then i unlocked most things and beat the final boss and tried out endless mode even though the RNG was wearing on me already.

I hated it. I fucking hate the RNG in this game. You can be doing so well then all of a sudden the game is fucking over. I get it's a rogue like right, but I haven't played a good rogue like that can literally end your run immediately if you're doing well. You can get hampered, you can get close to losing, but this game can just END it. Immediatley. No chance of saving it.

The shell game aspect is okay sometimes. If it moves at normal speeds and doesn't shuffle itself more than 2 times you can usually get the card you want. But sometimes it just moves super fast and you have a flat 25% chance to get anything because it is 100% shuffled. Has ruined alot of games for me.

Then the combat finally started wearing on me. You press a button to block and a button to swing your weapon. That's pretty much it if you don't have an ability or an artifact. I would press a button to block a projectile then I'd get hit by an unlblockable attack, yes they can come out very quickly and give you no time to respond, which in turn would let me get hit by the projectile, which would in turn let me get hit by some other asshole. I find most games that can let you get juggled by AI, especially when there's such a large amount sometimes, to be absolutely unplayable. It's not fun. I don't watch other people play games and I sure as hell don't want to watch the AI play a fucking game with my body.

I want to mention there is no way to view the board if you get a card that reveals the whole thing. You get to see it for a brief moment but after you comfirm that, you can't scroll through the cards on the board or anything. Really fucking agitating. Let me see the board, I spent a wholel turn unlocking it.

The dude says the same thing over and over again. Kind of annoying. Also at times you'll be trying to read some card description but he has a long winded speach and you're not sure if you need to listen to him or read the card so you end up doing neither. Or you just listen to him and it feels like a waste of time.

Lastly, there's bugs. Some times while looking at multiple cards there is no highlight so you don't know which card you have selected, you can guess usually but not all the time. Sometimes the main deck will get shuffled away but will end up being back in the middle of the board, blocking cards. The combat feels like one whole big bug too.


Like I said, I enjoyed it at first, but then it all just started wearing me down. The flaws caught up and just surpassed any enjoyment I got out of this game. Now it is pure frustration and anger at RNGesus hating me. I guess give it a shot if you are interested in this genre and think you are luck reincarnate.

I thought I would get bored quickly since the goal is to play several "matches" to beat each boss. However, it was not the case since the new cards that are continuously earned keeps the game interesting and not really repetitive.

Actually, the only issue I had with the game was the final boss who is ridiculously overpowered. The game gets more and more difficult but is manageable, however this final boss... it's just a lot of frustration especially since there is no "ending".

In any case, I still had a lot of fun and really recommend this game.
Very fun game but god damn, the combat really holds it back.
Oustanding. Is hard to find a good card game. Love this.

appDetails.name: Hand of Fate
appDetails.detailed_description:
Add Hand of Fate 2 to your wishlist in order to keep up to date on announcements and release details!

"Words fail me at describing just how seamlessly Defiant Development managed to blend the tailored experience aspect of deck building games with the hack-and-slash excitement of action-RPGs." - The Escapist

"If you are a fan of either old school adventure books, Gauntlet from its glory days, collectible card games, Rogue or just general fantasy, this game is for you" - Gamestyle 9/10

"Whether you are a CCG veteran or not, you need to play this game…right now!" - Godisageek 9/10

"Defiant Development’s newest project feels like playing a customizable card game, Dungeons & Dragons, and Batman: Arkham Asylum all at the same time; if that idea doesn’t excite you, then I have no idea what will." Gaming Union 9/10

Deckbuilding Comes to Life In hand Of Fate!


An infinitely replayable series of quests - earn new cards, build your deck, then try to defeat it!

Beyond the thirteen gates at the end of the world, the game of life and death is played. Draw your cards, play your hand, and discover your fate. Hand of Fate is a hybrid roguelike/action-RPG/deck builder, in which the player builds a set of cards into a deck, which is then used to deal out the dungeon floors through which they adventure. Upon entering a combat, all of the cards the player has collected fly into their hands as fully modeled 3D assets, and combat begins.

Build your deck, enter the world of Hand of Fate, and prepare to face the Ace of Skulls.

Key Features

  • Tabletop card game brought to vivid life.
  • A unique take on roguelike gameplay.
  • Visceral action-RPG combat.
  • Game changing gear and items make every play through unique.
  • Hundreds of encounters, items, armor, weapons, artifacts, and mysteries to unlock.
  • Unique deck building mechanics let you customise your own adventure, as you seek to defeat the Jack, Queen and King of each suit.

Microsoft Xbox 360® Controller (or equivalent) is recommended.

igdb.name: The Masterplan
igdb.summary:
The Masterplan is a tactical team-based game where you plan and execute bank robberies and other heists. The 2D top-down view gives you a great overview of what's happening at any given moment, allowing you to be a real criminal mastermind.

Set in 1971, a story written by Tom Jubert (FTL, The Swapper), hand-drawn graphics, and the soundtrack recorded by real musicians with real instruments that evoke the unique mood of a 70s crime movie.

reviews.review:
The game itself is quite interesting but I cannot recommend it because of the amount of bugs and wonky behavior. If the devs want to patch the game to be well playable, I'd give it a big thumbs up.

Right now it's just not worth it, _especially_ considering it's 20€ which is absurd for this kind "polish".

appDetails.name: The Masterplan
appDetails.detailed_description:
The Masterplan is an award-winning tactical squad-based heist game set in 1970s. The 2D top-down view gives you a great overview of what's happening at any given moment, allowing you to be a real criminal mastermind. Features hand-drawn 2D graphics and fun group control, granting you total control - at least until someone calls the cops and everything goes haywire.

During the game you'll need to heist your way through 20 unique hand-crafted heists in a persisting career mode, manage your crew from heist to heist by hiring the right goons and by making sure they are properly equipped. A test of a true mastermind will be to execute the plan to perfection, keep the goons alive, and walk away with the maximum loot from each heist.

Depending on your preference, you can hit your targets loud, or in stealth, or a mix of both. Keep the civilians under control, knock them out, or leave no witnesses. It's all up to you, just make sure you won't be there when the cops arrive - or be ready for a brutal firefight.

If you are hungry for more content on top of the campaign, you can test your mettle in the 8 challenge maps, built by the development team, available through Steam Workshop. And with Steam Workshop support, players can also create their own heists!

Key Features


  • Heist your target silently or go guns blazing - your choice (and your consequences)
  • Switch the game into Slow-Motion on demand, to give you time to plan and to give your orders
  • Control civilians and guards at gunpoint with the unique threaten system
  • Employ a variety of weaponry and gear, from pistols and bombs to shotguns and tranquilizer guns
  • Carry and hide bodies to avoid detection
  • Use disguises to infiltrate forbidden areas
  • Disable electrical systems
  • Manage your crew
  • Unlock and rob 20 unique heist locations, each allowing you to choose your own approach and play in a sandbox environment
  • Discover, plan, and execute the greatest heist in the history of mankind!
  • Access and create more heists and content via Steam Workshop

With the HTC Vive this game is awesome. Only 3.3 hours, but this game is a ton of fun to play even when not playing with the HMD. Totally worth every penny!
Its alright

This game is a ton of fun! It really is a test of effective communication for both players, the defuser (the player on the computer describing the bomb) & the "expert" (the player searching the bomb defusal manual for directions to defuse the bomb) . It seems to be intended as a party game , but you could potentially play with someone over the internet using something like discord or skype.
I also like that it is a way to play a game with my girlfriend without her having to also buy it since her laptop runs so few games. 
It can get so stressfull watching the timer count down, while your team mate is franticly searching the manual for which button to press or wire to cut. On several puzzles there are a lot of chances for misunderstandings or mishaps because either player gets flustered. There are other distractions that occur in game like the lights turning off in the room or the alarm clock on the table going off to try and distract you and waste precious time. When you defuse the bomb with only milliseconds left it feels so good though!
The bomb defusal manual comes as a PDF and you can use it that way, but I really recommend printing it out and putting it in a binder.
It is also available in a native Linux version now as well, which runs flawless for me.

A master class in frantic, fast paced and engaging gameplay.
Easy to play and understand, fiendish to master.
The best Co-op/Party game I have played ever!
Will either fix your friendships or destroy them entirely.
Really great game, love the Idea. Great to play with friends.
i dont have any friends to play this with,

Keep talking and Nobody explodes is a game for 2 or more players, in which you have two roles to play. One looks at the screen. He is in a room with a bomb with several 'modules' (see them as micro puzzles) that need to be completed in order to defusse it. There is one small catch though. The instructions in doing so are given to the player(s) that cannot see the bomb. WIth quick communication and the occasional scream and explosion you try to solve all the bombs.

The game is easy to pick up and the controlls are simple, making it good for parties, as even non-gamers won't have any trouble figuring out the controls. A great thing about it, is you only need one copy to be able to play this, and is completly offline (you have to have the manual printed though, but just viewing it on your phone works well enough). While the game is perhaps a bit expensive (ish) for the hours you get out of it, it offers fun for multiple people at the same time, so you could doubble or tripple that number.

In terms of gameplay-it's great. Graphics aren't amazing, but are good for low-end devices and graphics don't matter in general. Controlls are simple, and the ''campain'' levels are well structered (easy to hard). They are also randomized every time you play them (they have some requirements like they have to have a certain module, and they have a fixed amount of them), making it fun for people that have played in already and are teaching newbies. It also offers a high score, so you can have some competition in it.

Besides the main campain the game also offers a randomizer, where you can pick a number of modules, time etc. and just start playing an infinite amount of generated bombs, making the replay value really good. The steam workshop offers a few mods for extra modules and maps, just in case you got bored.

The only real negative thing about this game that it does require a game or two to fully understand, especially the manual is a bit of a struggle to understand when first playing it. So keep in mind you will need at least 10-15 min to really start playing, as some explaining is required in order to have fun.

FInaly I should mention it has VR support, and while I don't have VR, this game seems to be the perfect macht with it.

Pros
+Great concept, lots of fun
+Awesome party game, even for non-gamers
+Easy to play, hard to master
+Requires only one, not very good PC
+VR support
+Great replay value, with workshop and randomizer

Cons:
-Price might be a little too high if you are only planning on playing this for a few times
-Does require a few games to really get into it, so not really good for very short sessions
-Cannot be played alone (well if you really want to, but this is a partygame)

Overall a great game, must have for anyone, even non-gamers.
8.5/10
It's a great game and I would recomend it but I am refunding it because I just gambled away my CS:GO inventory.

I kept on talking but I still exploded.


false advertising.

appDetails.name: Keep Talking and Nobody Explodes
appDetails.detailed_description:
Now with Motion Control Support!

HTC Vive and Oculus Touch motion controllers are now supported! Grab a bomb and get defusing!


Includes Steam Workshop Support

Mod support has been added! Check out the Steam Workshop to try out new modules, missions, a driveable bus, a double bomb with up to 23 modules, sound packs, and much more!


About the Game

In Keep Talking and Nobody Explodes, one player is trapped in a virtual room with a ticking time bomb they must defuse. The other players are the “Experts” who must give the instructions to defuse the bomb by deciphering the information found in the bomb defusal manual. But there’s a catch: the experts can’t see the bomb, so everyone will need to talk it out – fast!

Rounds are fast-paced, tense, occasionally silly, and almost always loud. Everybody has a role to play whether they are defusing the bomb or not. Swap out between rounds and share the experience with all of your friends!

Puzzle solving and communication skills - and maybe a few friendships - will be put to the test as players race to defuse bombs while communicating quickly, clearly, and effectively.

Features

  • Challenging puzzles that will test the limits of your communication skills… and friendships?
  • A different bomb every time! Procedurally generated puzzles keep the action fresh.
  • Local multiplayer party game – A great way to experience VR with all of your friends at the same time!
  • Only one copy of the game needed! If you can talk to the bomb defuser, you can be their expert! Try using your favorite voice chat service and playing remotely.
  • Mod support! Try out new modules, missions, and more from the community with Steam Workshop!

The bomb defusal manual is freely available at http://www.bombmanual.com and can be printed or viewed on a tablet or any other web-enabled device.

igdb.name: Grim Fandango Remastered
igdb.summary:
Something's rotten in the land of the dead, and you're being played for a sucker. Meet Manny Calavera, travel agent at the Department of Death. He sells luxury packages to souls on their four-year journey to eternal rest. But there's trouble in paradise. Help Manny untangle himself from a conspiracy that threatens his very salvation. 
 
One of the most acclaimed adventure games of all time is now back, better than ever. Grim Fandango's epic story of four years in the life (or death) of Manny Calavera, travel agent to the dead, has been remastered to look, sound, and control even better than when it won GameSpot's Game of the Year award upon its original launch. Grim Fandango still stands as a classic of the genre, with unforgettable characters and unique combination of film noir and Mexican folklore.

reviews.review: kind of like dark souls, but instead of getting killed by skeletons, you are a skeleton.

this sat in my library untouched for a year.

i decided to install it out of complete boredom.

it's now my alltime favorite game, ever.

how the fuck did that happen? well you see, it all started when this really nice lady walked into my office...

This is one of the best stories in a game I've seen by far. Point & Click is one of my favorite genres and this is by far one of the best point&click adventure games out there. Just buy it for the story in my opinion if the genre puts you off. 

9/10

PS the soundtrack is great. If you're into jazz it's deffinetly worth the price, otherwise it's still just great music.

I initially had doubts about this game. I wasn’t much of a point-and-click type of fan. I keep hearing a lot of people say this game is good, in aspects of its aesthetics, its story, its puzzles, and a lot more to be praised upon. Didn’t think much about it, since i thought this game was overrated. But whoowe, it was wrong of them to ever doubt it.

This game is so damn good. I like it very much. It is aesthetically pleasing as a lot of people have mentioned. The story was interesting and was never ever boring to me, ever. The puzzles were quite tricky though ( maybe it’s just me cause I’m kinda new to this type of genre of games or just too slow to figure them out, might be both), but they weren’t such a headache to figure it out (or just look up a guide). The characters? Oh, i love Manny and Glottis so much. They’re just the best. Great  voice acting as well, really. And i love the small details they made to make this game enjoyable and funny, especially the dialogues and achievements.

As for the cons, i wouldn’t really say it’s that many. Just glitches. Only happened once when i was playing my game and it was hilarious. Nothing much about this game’s cons.

Would recommend highly. It has certainly opened my eyes towards these types of games. Try something different once in a while. If you are, this game is a must.
"You can't hide from the Grim Reaper. Especially when he's got a gun." ~Manuel Calavera
Great game!

Highly  reccomended, as stated it's a point & click classic that was made by the gaming comedy legend Double Fine.
You're a skeleton agent in the corrupt purgatory in a buisness that sells transportation tickets to get to other layers of the underworld. Your character got jealous that only his partner gets premium users (practically saints) so he steals a job from him and goes off to harvest the newly dead, and this little jealousy leads you down to the ends of the world through fire beavers to gigant pure gold statues of cats with plenty of jokes along the way.
mannnnnny you prommmmissssed

Grim Fandango Remastered .  Its such a cool storyline and cool concept for a game straight away . I wont explain the storyline to you but its really really good . The voice acting is awesome . You can tell that there was a lot of effort put into this game . Its a pure point and click adventure with puzzels . If thats not your thing look elsewhere. If that is your thing than I strongly reccomend it  . 

As far as point and Clicks go , its a 9/10 SO FAR . I STILL HAVE LOTS OF GAME LEFT TO PLAY .

Very good remaster, stayed true to the original concept. It is a game resurrected from the golden age of Lucas Arts games. I am looking forward to play more remastered hidden treasures like this one.

About the game itself: A really unique and funny take on the afterlife, set in a day of the dead/mexican/mayan/aztec noir theme. It has a lots of references and easter eggs to be found. Simple but sometimes challenging game, which was common in that gaming era. As you progress you are presented with a slightely harder puzzles and scenarios. But it is very rewarding when you finnally piece together the puzzles. 
Loved the music, especially that they composed big band and jazzy sounds too. The music and sounds perfectly captures what the visuals estabilish.
The controls are pretty solid and clean. I played it with a controller and it is good with it too. They ported it really well.
I haven't finished it yet, but I feel that it is a game that deserves to be played from time to time. 

Only negative is that sometimes there are places in the game where the controls can be a little bit jammy when there are a lot of things in a realitvely small scene, but not a big deal. This doesn't ruin the gaming experience.

Overall it is a fun and very nostlagic game too. Thanks for the revival, and consider digging up more gems like this.
Amazing game keep up all the good work!
I liked it! Charming world and dialogs.

Grim Fandango is a game that, at the peak of the era of classic adventure games, stood as a high mark of the genre. It is one of the best and most beloved Lucasarts titles, as well as one of the last adventure games the company developed. Grim Fandango's film noir story, reminiscent in tone to noire classics such as The Maltese Falcon, is peppered with dark humor and superbly written. Combined with the game's aztec and art deco inspired visual design, and latin and jazz influenced musical score, it created a truly unique and exceptional atmosphere compared to other adventure titles of the 90's.

PROS
+ Wonderful and unique atmosphere and visual design
+ Dark, film noir narrative, often heartfelt, with plenty of witty and charming humor
+ Good length for an adventure game, and satisfying to play to its conclusion
+ Superb writing, dialogue and narrative still hold up for the most part, marred by a couple cringy lines
+ Excellent voice acting
+ Soundtrack is one of the best in the adventure genre. Evocative and beautiful, it perfectly fits the atmosphere and has been totally remastered using a live orchestra
+ Improved controls - use a mouse, controller, or the original keyboard only tank controls (there is even an achievement for playing through it the way it was originally designed)
+ Runs well on PC, as it should, did not encounter any bugs
+ Improved aspect ratio, now able to choose 16:9 stretched, or the original 4:3
+ Higher resolution character and 3d models
+ Improved real-time lighting and shadows
+ Enhanced cutscenes, movies look good considering the age of this game
+ Developer commentary added, can be funny at times
+ Achievements added

CONS:
- Prerendered backgrounds are unfortunately not remastered, look no different to the original
- Dialogue has not been enhanced or improved, and some static can be heard in a few lines
- Ability to switch between original and remastered mode is nothing but a curiosity, redundant, and not worth playing the game that way
- Outdated and often illogical puzzle design
- The archaic gameplay may be frustrating to some

Grim Fandango Remastered can not, if we are being honest with ourselves, be called a complete remaster. Had the backgrounds been completely redone, or the dialogue cleaned up in a few places, this would be a different story. As it is, the remaster feels more like a touch-up of a beloved classic, albeit a damn good one. It stays faithful to the original - the humor still works, the strength of the original voice acting still shines, the game is still steeped in that lovely film noir atmosphere and is a blast to replay for someone who grew up in that golden age, the 90's. Despite the few flaws this remaster has, it is still the best way to experience the high point of a gaming era which has, sadly, long gone by. Get it on sale, or for full price if you're an old school fan, worth it for the nostalgia alone.

FINAL VERDICT: 8/10

appDetails.name: Grim Fandango Remastered
appDetails.detailed_description:
The Making of Grim Fandango Remastered

The makers of Grim Fandango discuss the development of the beloved adventure game and how Double Fine Productions plans to release the original classic to a contemporary audience. Watch The Making of Grim Fandango Here!


About the Game

Something's rotten in the land of the dead, and you're being played for a sucker. Meet Manny Calavera, travel agent at the Department of Death. He sells luxury packages to souls on their four-year journey to eternal rest. But there's trouble in paradise. Help Manny untangle himself from a conspiracy that threatens his very salvation.

One of the most acclaimed adventure games of all time is now back, better than ever. Grim Fandango's epic story of four years in the life (or death) of Manny Calavera, travel agent to the dead, has been remastered to look, sound, and control even better than when it won GameSpot's Game of the Year award upon its original launch. Grim Fandango still stands as a classic of the genre, with unforgettable characters and unique combination of film noir and Mexican folklore.

Remastered version includes

  • Repainted, hi-res character textures
  • New, dynamic lighting
  • Classic score re-recorded with a full live orchestra
  • Over 2 hours of exclusive developer commentary
  • Concept art browser

igdb.name: Jazzpunk
igdb.summary: Jazzpunk is a single-player, first-person adventure game, focusing on exploration and comedy over puzzle-solving. Each mission has one central objective, but the player is free to explore the game world at their own pace, which is populated with a large number of interactive NPCs, each with their own action or gag. Mini-games, including mini-golf, a Frogger clone, and a version of Duck Hunt in which the player pelts cardboard ducks with slices of bread from a toaster, also feature prominently in the game's storyline.
igdb.storyline:
The game is centered around a top-secret espionage agency operating out of an abandoned subway station in late 1950's Japan. The player takes the role of Polyblank, a silent protagonist. The game begins when Polyblank is mailed to the espionage agency in a human-shaped suitcase. He is then given several missions by the head of the organization, all of which begin by ingesting a dose of prescription medicine and which end with the protagonist sitting on a bench in a Zen garden, feeding breadcrumbs to Koi fish. The missions assigned to Polyblank are almost always bizarre and nonsensical, relying heavily on free association and references to older movies and video games. Tasks include degaussing and smuggling pigeons, assassinating cowboys, cross-dressing, killing a pig with a six-string guitar, and photocopying Polyblank's bottom to fool a security scanner.
The first mission begins with Polyblank having to infiltrate a Soviet consulate to recover a data cartridge, the second to go to a sushi restaurant to steal a cowboy's artificial kidney. On the way back from the sushi restaurant, Polyblank is intercepted by agents telling him to 'hand over the wetware', but he escapes. The Director then states that Polyblank should take a holiday while they wait for things to die down. When Polyblank gets to Kai Tak Resort for his holiday, he receives a phone call telling him he has to find the syndicate man (The Editor) on site and switch briefcases with him. Polyblank succeeds, but then passes out after drinking a cocktail. Polyblank wakes up in a hotel room at night with a message telling him to come to the rear pool. In the empty rear pool, Polyblank talks to a man who tells him the resort is a simulation, and to get out he must find, kill and cook the mechanical pig. After doing this, and navigating an electric maze, Polyblank finds himself back in the subway station, only to find the Director and his secretary are cardboard cutouts. He then finds an audio message from the Editor telling him if he wants to see them again he should come to his house. Polyblank goes there, and he is told he must beat the Editor in a game of sport for the Director to be freed. Polyblank loses, and so must find prizes for the Editor. Polyblank does this, inflating the Editor's ego, then he pops the Editor with a needle. Polyblank then finds the Director, where to free him he must either press a button. No matter which Polyblank presses, the Director turns into a crocodile and eats Polyblank. The credits take place in the Director's intestines, and then Polyblank is giving special tablets to help him get out. The game ends after Polyblank takes the pills.

reviews.review:
I finished the game in about 3 hours.  Most of it was funny.  Most of it was really inventive and original.  You really should ignore the goals as long as possible and just run around clicking on random things.  There's a lot of fun to be had.

The biggest complaint I have is that it's just too short.  If it's only going to be a three hour game, it should be a lot cheaper.

Fun game with a really nice graphics style.
The small jokes and gags are great and work really well.
I felt like the game could have been longer and had a lot more content in it, but still was a very fun game.

8/10

This game is honestly one of the best games i've ever played. yes it's short, yes it's cheesy, but that's graet in a game like this. You should buy this game or paradigm. both great comedy games.10/10 Would buy again.

Can you name one game more creative than this one ?
This is a must play on Steam.
A short but funny game that warrants multiple playthroughs to find more secrets.
This was silly.
What's amazing about this is how it does comedy in a way that could only be done by a video game. It's very medium-specific comedy, & I wish more games played with that the way this one does.

This game is pure comedy, you should definitely buy it, although I recommend to buy it only when discounted, since it´s a short game. Also, if you have zero understanding about pop culture references, don´t bother buying it.
This game is what I imagine drugs are like.

There is no real gameplay, and I played 2.5 hours and not laughed once. The entire game is clicking random things and hoping something funny happens. Even for 4 bucks, I wouldn't recommend this. A waste of time, and money.

This game reminded me of those Putt Putt games my kids used to play, if they were made by a 12 year old who was just learning how to program in Flash.  It's literally just running around clicking on things to see what they will do.  I guess some people might find it funny, if they're on drugs or have an IQ below 50, but I just thought it was stupid.  Wasted an hour of my life on this garbage,

appDetails.name: Jazzpunk: Director's Cut
appDetails.detailed_description:
Jazzpunk is a comedy adventure set in an alternate reality Cold War World, plagued with corporate espionage, CyberCrime, and sentient martinis. Gameplay is inspired by spoof comedy films and cartoons of yesteryear, with a focus on weird gadgets, exotic locales, and open-world style exploration.

Key Features:

  • Stereographic Polygony Soundeo™, NOW IN COLOURVISON.
  • A cast of over 360,000 polygons, working in concert.
  • For the first time ever, the human voice captured and preserved in CryoSonic Stasis™, thawed before your very ears during NPC exchanges (voice acting).
  • Windows/Mac/Linux/Suppository
  • Half a dozen jokes.
  • Contains 5% of recommended daily intake of vitamin C++
  • Original soundtrack featuring exotic percussion and homemade analog electronic instruments.

Find out why PC Gamer says Jazzpunk is "easily one of the funniest games in years."

igdb.name: Neon Chrome
igdb.summary:
Neon Chrome is a ruthless top-down cyberpunk shooter with rogue-like elements. The game takes place inside an arcology – a massive sci-fi mega structure. Every gaming session is different as large parts are randomly generated. 
 
Blast your way through walls with guns and cybernetic abilities and try alternate approaches with different roles like the Hacker or the Cyber Psycho. Upgrade your character stats, discover new cybernetic enhancements and build up strength to finally stop the Overseer. Every death is a new beginning – the path to stopping the Overseer is never the same.

reviews.review: Neon Chrome is a top down roguelike shooter. The weapons have punch to them, the soundtrack is decent, and it kept me hooked until I beat the main story.  Don't mind the playtime, I played a lot offline, I have more like 20+ hours on it.  Would recommend.
Its Crimsonland with cyberpunk setting.. works for me. Gets better after you beat it, then sample the arena mode, then go for that Overseer 2.0. Seeding of levels gets incredible.

appDetails.name: Neon Chrome
appDetails.detailed_description:
Neon Chrome is a ruthless twin-stick top-down shooter with procedurally generated levels and destructible environment.

  • Completely destructible environment
  • Persistent character development using loot from your runs
  • Enemies ranging from security guards to massive boss hover tanks
  • Perk system in the form of cybernetic enhancements
  • Procedurally generated levels - endless replayability
  • Over a dozen weapons
  • Discover & unlock enhancements, abilities and weapons
  • Experiment with level editor & mods

Neon Chrome was created by 10tons - the company behind the cult hit game Crimsonland.


Use your looted credits to permanently improve your stats like health, luck and damage. Your character also improves with guns and cybernetics during a run. Visit your nearest upgrade station and select from a choice of over four dozen enhancements. The enhancements range from health and protection improvements to defense and assault systems - and far beyond.


After each death the game will generate a completely new path always ending in a final showdown. The Overseer controlling everything trusts his obedient minions to end your journey before you reach him. Your path will be a mix of randomly generated futuristic environments and hand crafted challenges.

Before each run you choose one of three randomized "assets". The asset is a unique combination of role, weapon, and ability. Each one a bit different - everyone as good as dead. They will have all your permanent stat improvements in addition to their original qualities. The sneaky assassin with mines or the robust corp soldier with incendiary grenades? The choice is up to you.


Almost everything in Neon Chrome can be destroyed with weapons or cybernetic abilities. You’ll shoot through walls, make rooms explode, and obliterate whole floors while blasting your way through the building.

Overcome the latest killing solutions ranging from armed security to lethal assault drones and cyborgs. The building hosts a small army and even devastating military robots. To make your way to the top you also need to overcome handcrafted combat and puzzle challenges.


If your friends would like to help you bringing down the Overseer Neon Chrome supports 2-4 players in shared screen local co-op!


Armed with your skills, weapons, and cybernetic abilities you’ll have a fighting chance of stopping the Overseer. Go on, venture into the Neon Chrome and remember: Death is always a new procedurally generated beginning.

igdb.name: 10 Second Ninja
igdb.summary:
Ninja's are awesome, this is an established fact of the universe. Nazi Robots from space however are not. They are trying to take over the Earth and their leader Robot Hitler is out to get you, the world's first ninja. You have 10 seconds to destroy all Nazi Robots in your vicinity and face the ultimate challenge: Hitler Robot himself. THE GAME IS ON. 
 
10 Second Ninja is a blisteringly fast platformery, actiony, sort of puzzley gamey thing. The player (that's you) is given the task of eliminating all of the enemies in each stage in 10 seconds or less. How hard could that be?

reviews.review: Pretty fun

appDetails.name: 10 Second Ninja
appDetails.detailed_description:
Ninjas are cool, this is an established fact of the universe. Nazi Robots from space are not cool, they are the complete opposite of cool, and Robot Hitler is out to get you, the world's first ninja.

You have 10 seconds to destroy all Nazi Robots in your vicinity. IT. IS. ON.

Become the ultimate Ninja and take down Robot Hitler’s automated autocracy in this blisteringly fast platformer.

Ready, Steady, Ninja!

Features


  • Blitz through 40 challenging levels!
  • Fight again and again to get the best time possible and a glorious three star rating!
  • Break your controller or keyboard out of anger!
  • Battle your friends down to the millisecond on the leaderboards
  • Prove you know how to play games and collect all 30 achievements

Warning: This game contains flashing images. It is advised that you do not play if you suffer from photosensitive epilepsy.
